message.content:
cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a new autonomous braking system based on deep reinforcement learning, which involves the use of artificial intelligence and robotics (cs.RO) to learn an optimal policy for brake control through computer simulations using deep Q-network (DQN) (cs.AI). The system uses sensors to obtain information on the obstacle, which could involve computer vision (cs.CV) techniques. The problem is formulated as a Markov decision process (MDP) model, which is a common framework in reinforcement learning (cs.LG). Finally, the proposed system is designed to operate in uncertain environments, which could involve control systems (cs.SY).
